I have been using this for a couple of weeks, and everything was working well. Blocking domains is quite interesting job. Before this, I had been using Rethink for a long time. But this app is really lighter than Rethink, and I appreciate that. However, the only issue I have been encountering with this app is setting up the Cloudflare DNS protocol. That's why I can't browse some of the sites blocked by the government. I am going back to rethink until i find a solution..
google_play_reviews.replyContent: PersonalDNSfilter supports the Clouflare DNS server on 1.1.1.1, so there shouldn't be a problem with this. You can configure this in the DNS settings. Make sure you disable DNS Server discovery in the DNS settings of pDNSf.

google_play_reviews.replyContent: The app only sends DNS requests to DNS Servers. It doesn't send further data. In addition it logs DNS requests in a local log file, which will stay local on the device and won't be sent. In addition it is open source, so experts can check the code.

google_play_reviews.replyContent: you should whitelist "s.youtube.com". This will solve your issue.

google_play_reviews.content: I like to open it from time to time, and see what else got blocked. But picture this, I enabled a bunch of filters, and now some websites don't open. I'm not familiar with how indexing works in this app, but can the running log tell "this domain was blocked by this filter"?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Unfortunately there is no info after indexing about the filter list a specific domain belongs to.

Hi. personalDNSfilter can not block first party ads like in Facebook, Insta and YT.
That's not possible by filtering DNS.
For YT use newpipe and for other apps use alternative clients.

https://www.zenz-solutions.de/faq/ - https://www.zenz-solutions.de/help/

google_play_reviews.content: There should be a sensible GUI selection of trustworthy DNS providers and filter lists. The current interface is quite unintuitive and completely ignores UI design norms. Better UI design matters in more ways than one, as it makes the app far easier to use, and can reduce the amount of low-effort bad reviews caused by avoidable user confusion. This app is extremely efficient and can be considered a job well done, but still leaves much to be desired in the UI department.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks a lot for your detailed review. Yes, the UI is very basic. Please keep in mind, that this is a free software, developed by 1 person only during rarely free time. So unfortunately there is no UI department ;-). But thanks a lot for this constructiv feedback! It shows me your appreciation.

google_play_reviews.content: It's a great app, and it can block ads (that it identifies as ads, but it obviously can't block ads on the YouTube app because that's harder/impossible to identify). However, it does slow my connection down a bit (more than a VPN does), and there really is no way to trust that the developer won't be looking at your data. Therefore, I am willing to give up the AdBlock feature to use a trusted VPN. The service is still great, I just have security concerns.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
3 stars is a bad rating for a great and free open source app.
The source code is open - in case it would steel data or such, experts would already have found and published this.
I do not think it is a good idea to raise such assumption without any facts here.
This app should not slow down anything - it does not interferre data stream, only DNS.

google_play_reviews.content: Very nice. But there is scope for improvement. The developers should make detailed video on each feature. They can add keyword blocking feature. It will make it more robust. I like the ui, it is geeky. I want to know how exactly does the whitelist and blacklist work. I tried to block a few sites using the config additional hosts, but it didn't work. But overall it is very well done. New versions are awaited.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Thanks for your friendly review.
Please check additional host configuration (advanced settings) for details on how to whitelist or blacklist additional hosts. Such changes require an app restart in order to take effect. Feel free to join our TG channel for further discussion on this topic.

google_play_reviews.content: Why does it need access to my files and media?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Because the app creates a folder on your device storage called /PersonalDNSFilter - in there are config files. You can even configure advanced stuff editing those files. And you can backup settings of the app, so storage access is needed for that too.
